intro: Hieracium saxifragum subsp. lurlejense, commonly known as the Lurlejense Hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow disk flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its compact growth habit and relatively small, daisy-like flowers. It typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized plant with specific ecological requirements.
